text: The San Marcos Province is one of the thirteen provinces in the Cajamarca Region of Peru. It was created by Law No. 23508 on December 11, 1982 by president Fernando Belaunde Terry. Municipalidad Provincial de San Marcos, Historia. Retrieved on November 4, 2007. It has a mountainous territory which varies in height from 1,500 to more than 4,000 meters above sea level. The province is crossed by several rivers, the most important of which is the Marañón. Municipalidad Provincial de San Marcos, Ubicación. Retrieved on November 4, 2007. ==Political division== The province is divided into seven districts. * Pedro Galvez (San Marcos) * Chancay (Chancay) * Eduardo Villanueva (La Grama) * Gregorio Pita (Paucamarca) * Ichocan (Ichocán) * José Manuel Quiroz (Shirac) * José Sabogal (Venecia) ==Notes== Category:Provinces of the Cajamarca Region
title: San Marcos Province
